description: An Azure Entra ID identity that is used by applications, such as Terraform, to provide programmatic access to Azure.
A cross-platform tool that allows developers to run tasks in a containerized environment, facilitating builds and deployments.
A software application that provides comprehensive facilities to programmers for software development. It typically includes a code editor, debugger, and build automation tools.
A text-based interface used to interact with software and operating systems, allowing users to execute commands and scripts.
A set of rules and protocols for building and interacting with software applications, enabling different software systems to communicate with each other.
A unique reference number used as an identifier in software applications, ensuring that no two identifiers are the same across systems.
An abbreviation used to indicate a summary of a longer text, often used to provide a quick overview of the main points for readers who may not have time to read the full content.
A user identifier in Azure Entra ID that is formatted like an email address, typically used to log in to services and applications.
A Microsoft service that provides a set of tools for software development, including version control, project management, and build automation.
